23. TheStoic system, as thus set forth, is in the main log- ical and consistent3 but evidently any attempt to apply it to the facts of common life would meet with failure. They themselves acknowledged that the ideal sapiens had almost never existed3 Zeno himself did not claim to be such, and his followers could hardly aspire to be better than he.
